snippet: State lawmakers agreed on Wednesday to add 120 speed-tracking cameras to the city’s streets, providing a significant addition to the city’s automated enforcement devices.
abstract: New York State lawmakers agree to add 120 speed-tracking cameras to New York City's streets, providing significant addition to automated enforcement devices already in place as de Blasio administration seeks to improve traffic safety; devices can only be used in school zones, during school hours.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and THOMAS KAPLAN

lead_paragraph: State lawmakers agreed on Wednesday to add 120 speed-tracking cameras to the city’s streets, providing a significant addition to the city’s automated enforcement devices.

headline.main: State Backs More Cameras to Catch Speeders Near New York City’s Schools
headline.print_headline: State Backs More Cameras to Catch Speeders Near City’s Schools
